group_1.textLeft: On that note,
didn't you mention that in the head family's village,@you guys host a ceremony on New Year's Day?
What's that all about?

group_1.textRight: According to Chiharu and the others,
it is "a traditional ceremony to welcome the@first sunrise by sealing away evil and calamities."
That's what I've heard, at least...@[chara:304701:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:304701:motion_200][chara:304701:lipSynch_1]But I'd like to know more.
We don't know much about it either,@though.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, this is our first time participating.

group_1.textCenter: Well...we never really talked about it, have we?
It's done on the dawn of New Year's Day...

group_1.narration: "It is a ritual to appease the cup@that contains evil."
"The sake cup has been passed from generation@to generation in the village where I was@born and raised..."
"Throughout the years,@it accumulates the seeds of evils@and calamities from the surrounding area."
"Once the cup reaches its limit,@rain clouds gather around Kirimine Town@shortly before New Year's Day,@and the weather turns stormy..."

"So once every few years,@the head of the Tokime Clan touches@the sake cup with a ceremonial sword that, too,@has been passed down throughout the generations,@to quell the evil sealed within the cup."
"Once complete, the clouds break and@a beautiful sunrise spills across the sky@as a sign of the ceremony's success."

group_1.textCenter: Hence why it is called the "Daybreak Ceremony."

group_1.textRight: Daybreak...?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, as in the light of dawn.

group_1.textRight: ...It's a bit mysterious, with the overcast@clouds and the sky clearing up...
Who decides the year that the ceremony@should be held?

group_1.textLeft: It used to be Mikoshiba in charge of that.

group_1.textRight: Mikoshiba...
That was a family of incredible influence who@exploited the Tokime Clan for generations...right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes...but Mikoshiba is no more.
Even so, her shadow continues to darken@our lives, including this ritual...

group_1.textRight: Yeah, it's not something you can just@brush off, is it?

group_1.textLeft: The ceremony has been ingrained in us@for so long. We can't simply...change it.

group_1.textRight: Well...you must be anxious, yeah?
...Crap, sorry! Didn't mean to derail@your story.
So, back to the ritual.
So the ritual being carried out was@Mikoshiba's decision?

group_1.textLeft: ...Yes, and it's quite wondrous.
Whenever Mikoshiba said,@"We must carry out the ceremony next year,"
the weather was always rough from the end@of the year until New Year's Day.
After performing the ritual according@to her instructions,
as soon as it was complete,@the clouds would immediately clear...
I've seen it for myself, and it's been@like this for hundreds of years...

group_1.textRight: For hundreds of years?!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, and this coming New Year's Day, we must@perform the "Daybreak Ceremony" again.

group_1.textRight: ...That's what the late Mikoshiba said?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, she said it on New Year's Day this year.

group_1.textRight: How did she figure out if you needed@to do the ritual?

group_1.textLeft: I have no idea...
I just took it for granted back when@she was still around.

group_1.textRight: A sake cup for stowing away calamities...
Why the hell do you have something@so dangerous in the village?

group_1.textLeft: According to legend...
It is said that the people of the neighboring villages,@who struggled with handling the cup, turned to the@power of a Diviner and entrusted it to her,
in hopes that she could quell the cup@that held these evils...

group_1.textRight: So in those days, even people beyond@our village relied on the Diviners.
...Is that right?

group_1.textLeft: I suppose so.

group_1.textRight: ...What happens if the ritual goes wrong?

group_1.textLeft: It is said that a terrible disaster will@befall us all,
impacting not just our village, but Kirimine@and the surrounding area as well...

group_1.textRight: You sure it'll be okay...?
Wasn't Mikoshiba the one running@this ritual all this time?

group_1.textLeft: ...I can't say I'm not worried.
The adults are investigating the correct@procedure, however.
Yeah, my mom's the one in charge of that.

group_1.narration: "This is it... It's all over...! Somebody...! Help..."
